column4: hello @ll, I'm upgrading to Lubuntu  11.04 to 12.04 but it seems to run  in the background : no screen message, only a 70-80% "precise" process seen on task monitor. How can I control what's happening there ?
how did you upgrade
I just pushed the button on my upgrade monitor...
you might look for the lubuntu channel cause i dont know what youre talking about
sorry, I meant update-notifier
so you didnt get a guy anywhere in the entire process?
: nope,   " upgrade monitor" disapeared once I clicked on "upgrade to 12.04", and now "precise" is running in the background, that's all

thats really strange. you're screwed basically.strace it and see if it's reading files or something. otherwise tail -f /var/log/dpkg.log and see if it's installing packages or something. otherwise look around the screen for your disappeared window
my sceen is not that big :-) I 'll check at your suggestions
: this is my strace -p upon precise : pretty busy indeed, with a lot of "no such file or directory", see http://pastebin.com/ABmyft0a
the no such file or directory spam is normal. you're more looking for whether it's a constant flow of spam. check the dpkg.log next

anyway if it's a busy process you can either wait it out and monitor the strace spam or you can probably more or less safely kill it and do dpkg --configure -a and apt-get -f install to try to finish the upgrade process if that's what it's apaprently secretly trying to do
frankly ubuntu devs don't suprise me any more, a hidden gui might be expected behavior nowadays
: I would say nothing happens, time here is 21.43 and nothing happens since 07.05... see http://pastebin.com/5k4Wkzr0
I'll do what you said  (kill it and do dpkg --configure -a and apt-get -f install)
stopped on libc-bin...well ......just pray you didnt get a libc upgrade failure like i did it's a huge pain in the ass to fix
so what happend after killing etc
: my PC breathes now ! CPU calmed down and so did the ventilation. dpkg did not propose anything so I switched to apt-get upgrade that seems to work fine at the moment.

also do apt-get dist-upgrade to be sure. the ubuntu devs arent the brightest crayons in the box, the missing gui seems like it was probably a use case they didnt account for when there is an upgrade probably of some kind
: do you mean after apt-get upgrade ? or should I stop apt-get upgrade to do apt-get dist-upgrade ?

before or after. doesn't really matter. better to do it before, but worse case scenario is you just upgrade oneeric or whatever, then re-upgrade precise. since you're already in apt-get upgrade you'll basically have to finish anyway
ok. at least something's happening
no problem i'll be expecting my check in the mail
